com.apriori.graph

Class Graph.Computation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.graph.Graph.Computation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of value produced by the computation
    Enclosing class:
    Graph<T>

    public static class Graph.Computation<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A single instance of the computation graph. This represents a single invocation of the graph. Executing the computation involves binding its required inputs and then calling the compute() method.

    This class is not thread safe. Multiple threads can safely share references to the graph and then each create their own computations. Since the result of the computation is a future, that too can be shared across threads. But the computation itself is not intended for use from multiple threads.

    • Method Detail

      • graph

        public Graph<T> graph()
        Returns the graph that defines the structure of this computation.
        Returns:
        the graph that defines the structure of this computation

      • bindInput

        public <U> Graph.Computation<T> bindInput(java.lang.Class<U> type,
                                          U input)
        Binds an input value to the computation. All inputs must be bound before the computation can execute. If the input key has a qualifier, you must use bindInput(Key, Object) instead.

        This is shorthand for the following:
        computation.bindInput(Key.of(type), input);

        Parameters:
        type - the type of the input key
        input - the value to bind to this input
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this computation has already been executed (computations can only be used once)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given type does not correspond to an input of this computation
        See Also:
        Graph.inputKeys()

      • bindAsyncInput

        public <U> Graph.Computation<T> bindAsyncInput(java.lang.Class<U> type,
                                               ListenableFuture<U> input)
        Binds an async input to the computation. All inputs must be bound before the computation can execute. If the input key has a qualifier, you must use bindAsyncInput(Key, ListenableFuture) instead.

        This is shorthand for the following:
        computation.bindAsyncInput(Key.of(type), input);

        Parameters:
        type - the type of the input key
        input - the future whose result will be bound to this input
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this computation has already been executed (computations can only be used once)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given type does not correspond to an input of this computation
        See Also:
        Graph.inputKeys()

      • compute

        public ListenableFuture<T> compute()
        Executes the computation. The returned future will complete when the computation is done. The future will then yield the result of the computation.

        Computations are intended to be invoked once. If this method is called a subsequent time, the same future is returned as from the initial call.

        Returns:
        a future that produces the result of the computation
